mn22:18.2.pli: “siyā nu kho, bhante, bahiddhā asati paritassanā”ti?
mn22:18.2.en: “Sir, can there be anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally?”

mn22:18.8.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī”ti.
mn22:18.8.en: That’s how there is anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally.”

mn22:19.1.en: “But can there be no anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally?”

mn22:19.7.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati aparitassanā hotī”ti.
mn22:19.7.en: That’s how there is no anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally.”

mn22:20.1.pli: “Siyā nu kho, bhante, ajjhattaṁ asati paritassanā”ti?
mn22:20.1.en: “But can there be anxiety about what doesn’t exist internally?”

mn22:20.9.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, ajjhattaṁ asati paritassanā hotī”ti.
mn22:20.9.en: That’s how there is anxiety about what doesn’t exist internally.”

mn22:21.1.en: “But can there be no anxiety about what doesn’t exist internally?”

mn22:21.9.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, ajjhattaṁ asati aparitassanā hoti.
mn22:21.9.en: That’s how there is no anxiety about what doesn’t exist internally.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 22
The Simile of the Snake

sn22.8:1.2.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you how grasping leads to anxiety, and how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.

sn22.8:1.4.en: And how does grasping lead to anxiety?

sn22.8:1.14.en: That’s how grasping leads to anxiety.

sn22.8:2.1.en: And how does not grasping lead to freedom from anxiety?

sn22.8:2.11.en: That’s how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 22
1. Nakula’s Father
8. Anxiety Because of Grasping (2nd)

sn22.7:1.2.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you how grasping leads to anxiety, and how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.

sn22.7:2.1.en: “And how does grasping lead to anxiety?

sn22.7:5.6.en: That’s how grasping leads to anxiety.

sn22.7:6.1.en: And how does not grasping lead to freedom from anxiety?

sn22.7:9.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, anupādā aparitassanaṁ hotī”ti.
sn22.7:9.6.en: That’s how not grasping leads to freedom from anxiety.”

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 22
1. Nakula’s Father
7. Anxiety Because of Grasping

pli-tv-kd1:36.10.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṁ vā saddhivihāriṁ vā gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā, anabhirataṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā, uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ āpattiṁ na jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṁ na jānāti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.10.2.en: He’s not capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or to have someone nurse him when he’s sick; to send him away or to have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he doesn’t know the offenses; and he doesn’t know how offenses are cleared.

pli-tv-kd1:36.11.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṁ vā saddhivihāriṁ vā gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā, anabhirataṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā, uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ āpattiṁ jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṁ jānāti—
pli-tv-kd1:36.11.2.en: He’s capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or to have someone nurse him when he’s sick; to send him away or to have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; and to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he knows the offenses; and he knows how offenses are cleared.

pli-tv-kd1:37.9.2.pli: Na paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṁ vā saddhivihāriṁ vā gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā, anabhirataṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā, uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ, āpattiṁ na jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṁ na jānāti, ūnadasavasso hoti—
pli-tv-kd1:37.9.2.en: He’s not capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or to have someone nurse him when he’s sick; to send him away or to have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know how offenses are cleared; and he has less than ten years of seniority.

pli-tv-kd1:37.10.2.pli: Paṭibalo hoti antevāsiṁ vā saddhivihāriṁ vā gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā, anabhirataṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā, uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ, āpattiṁ jānāti, āpattiyā vuṭṭhānaṁ jānāti, dasavasso vā hoti atirekadasavasso vā—
pli-tv-kd1:37.10.2.en: He’s capable of three things in regard to a student: to nurse him or to have someone nurse him when he’s sick; to send him away or to have him sent away when he’s discontent with the spiritual life; to use the Teaching to dispel anxiety. And he knows the offenses; he knows how offenses are cleared; and he has ten or more years of seniority.

The long chapter

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.11.pli: “kiṁ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṁvattantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.11.en: “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu pātimokkhe uddissamāne evaṁ vadeyya—‘kiṁ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṁvattantī’ti, sikkhāpadavivaṇṇake pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:1.20.1.en: ‘When the Monastic Code is being recited, if a monk says, “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?” then in disparaging the training rules, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.8.pli: “kiṁ panimehi khuddānukhuddakehi sikkhāpadehi uddiṭṭhehi, yāvadeva kukkuccāya vihesāya vilekhāya saṁvattantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc72:2.1.8.en: “What’s the point of reciting these minor and insignificant training rules, when they just lead to anxiety, oppression, and annoyance?”

sn22.43:3.2.pli: Tesaṁ pahānā na paritassati, aparitassaṁ sukhaṁ viharati, sukhavihārī bhikkhu ‘tadaṅganibbuto’ti vuccati.
sn22.43:3.2.en: When these things are given up there’s no anxiety. Without anxiety you live happily. A mendicant who lives happily is said to be extinguished in that respect.

sn22.43:3.9.pli: Tesaṁ pahānā na paritassati, aparitassaṁ sukhaṁ viharati, sukhavihārī bhikkhu ‘tadaṅganibbuto’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn22.43:3.9.en: When these things are given up there’s no anxiety. Without anxiety you live happily. A mendicant who lives happily is said to be extinguished in that respect.”

pli-tv-kd3:6.4.4.pli: ‘kukkuccaṁ vinodessāmi vā, vinodāpessāmi vā, dhammakathaṁ vāssa karissāmī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.4.pli: So teneva kukkuccena tena vippaṭisārena kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto antomano līnamano dukkhī dummano vippaṭisārī pajjhāyi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj1:5.10.4.en: And because of his anxiety and remorse, he became thin, haggard, and pale, his veins protruding all over his limbs; he became sad, sluggish, miserable, depressed, remorseful, weighed down by grief.
